summary.p: He should settle a debt of 6 guilders for his brother Heinrich by [January 18] and asks Bullinger to lend him this amount. Greetings.

div.p: Peace and grace be with you.
My friendly greetings and heartfelt trust, dear cousin Master Heinrich. I want to let you know that we are all fresh and healthy by the grace of God, and we always like to hear from you and yours.

Furthermore, I want to let you know that much trouble and sorrow, and additionally costs and damages, are growing and coming upon us because of my brother, and especially I feel much discontent and have to endure much that I have never experienced before, and all this for no fault of my own. Therefore, I call upon you as a friend, for friends are known in times of need, as you have been helpful to me before and my trust is placed in you, you will not let me down; for I must now pay 6 guilders for the claim of those who have a legal matter with Heini, I must provide them with such money by this coming Sunday. But if this does not happen, I must endure severe punishment. Therefore, my friendly request to you is whether you might help me with such money. I promise to repay you honorably with such similar money or if you could perhaps pawn the fur and lend such money on it until you sell it; for I know no refuge other than you. Therefore, I ask you to be helpful to me so that I do not suffer further damage and punishment. Where I can, I will repay such to you.
I have much more to write to you, but I do not have the time. Nothing more, except God be with you, and greet your family for me.
Given on the 20th day in the year 35.
From me, Uli Bullinger in Brugg, your cousin.
To the honorable and well-learned Master Heinrich Bullinger, preacher in Zurich, my dear cousin, to be delivered.
